name: Incline Bench Press - Barbell
how_to_perform:
1. Set an adjustable bench to an incline of 30 to 45 degrees.
2. Load the desired weight onto the barbell and secure the weights with collars.
3. Sit on the bench and lean back, ensuring your back is flat against the bench with feet planted firmly on the ground.
4. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
5. Unrack the barbell by lifting it off the supports and hold it directly above your chest with arms fully extended.
6. Inhale as you lower the barbell slowly and under control to the upper chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle from your body.
7. Touch the bar lightly to your chest, ensuring not to bounce it off your chest.
8. Exhale as you press the barbell back upwards to the starting position, extending your arms fully without locking the elbows.
9. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
10. Carefully rack the barbell after completing your set by aligning it with the supports and letting it rest securely.
short_summary: The Incline Barbell Bench Press is an exercise used to target the upper part of the chest, performed on a bench set at an incline and using a barbell.
